intro: Sterculia amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian sterculia, is a tropical tree native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The tree can grow up to 30 meters tall and has large, palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. Its flowers are showy, with five pink or red petals, and it produces woody capsules containing numerous seeds. The plant is valued for its hard wood and has traditional uses in local medicine.
